acceptance-test-run.title: Podam should handle both native and wrapped byte values with @PodamByteValue annotation
acceptance-test-run.name: podamShouldHandleByteValuesWithThePodamByteValueAnnotation

test-step.description: When I invoke the factory manufacturing for <span class='step-parameter'>class uk.co.jemos.podam.test.dto.annotations.ByteValuePojo

Then the Object ByteRangeValuesPojo ( byteFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0 byteFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 19 byteFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 92 byteObjectFieldWithMinValueOnly = 0 byteObjectFieldWithMaxValueOnly = 68 byteObjectFieldWithMinAndMaxValue = 89 byteFieldWithPreciseValue = 12 ) should not be null
Then the byte value 0 should be greater or equal than 0
Then the byte value 19 should be lower or equal to 100
Then the byte value 92 should be between 0 and 100
Then the Object 0 should not be null
Then the byte value 0 should be greater or equal than 0
Then the Object 19 should not be null
Then the byte value 68 should be lower or equal to 100
Then the Object 89 should not be null
Then the byte value 89 should be between 0 and 100
The byte value 12 should be precisely 12
